meanings.def: easy to use or to do
examples: The wire brush is very handy for cleaning up old iron and steel.
The arrangement was handy for both of us.

meanings.def: located near to somebody/something; located or stored in a convenient place
examples: Always keep a first-aid kit handy.
Have you got a pen handy?
handy for (doing) something (British English) Our house is very handy for the station.

meanings.def: able to use your hands or tools to make or repair things well
examples: to be handy around the house
to be handy with a sewing machine
Lucy is quite handy with a drill!
The extra money came in very handy.
Don't throw that away—it might come in handy.
Take your penknife—you never know when it might come in handy.
